body: @tjgq @coeuvre We have reports from multiple users about these kinds of hangs. They seem to be caused by `--remote_cache_async`. In this particular case, it looks like the RemoteExecutionService is waiting on the `Phaser` even though no uploads are running anymore.

issue.title: [8.1.0] Bazel 8 hangs during build event upload

milestone.title: 8.1.0 release blockers
milestone.description: Issues that should be fixed before 8.1.0 release.

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.title: Use `Single.using` instead of `onError`/`onSuccess` for async uploads

labels.name: team-Remote-Exec
labels.description: Issues and PRs for the Execution (Remote) team

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
Users have reported hangs in Bazel's asynchronous remote cache uploads that may be happening because neither `onSuccess` nor `onError` is called on the observer.

Work towards #25232

issue.title: [8.1.0] Use `Single.using` instead of `onError`/`onSuccess` for async uploads

body:
A fix for this issue has been included in [Bazel 8.1.0 RC4](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/releases/tag/8.1.0rc4). Please test out the release candidate and report any issues as soon as possible.
If you're using Bazelisk, you can point to the latest RC by setting USE_BAZEL_VERSION=8.1.0rc4. Thanks!
@fmeum @westrik can you please check if [Bazel 8.1.0 RC4](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/releases/tag/8.1.0rc4) fixes the issue? Thanks
